alert.note: Alert for Sun Valley Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 17 at 11:31AM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: .Warm temperatures may melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY, MAY 25... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Idaho, including the following area, Sun Valley Region along Trail Creek. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Thursday, May 25. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - High flows and warming temperatures. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
